summary: An email chain from August 2019 forwarding a report from a retired FBI agent about a conversation overheard in a New Jersey bar regarding the Epstein case. The report mentions claims about money sent to a Swiss bank account after Epstein's death, four BOP employees involved, and alleged procedural failures at the jail. The subsequent vetting found no connections to the case.

persons.name: Jeff
persons.role: Former FBI agent, reporter of overheard conversation
persons.context: A retired FBI agent who overheard a conversation about the Epstein case at a bar in Montclair, NJ on August 16, 2019. He reported the conversation and took photos of the women involved.

persons.name: Osborn, A. (NY) (FBI)
persons.context: An FBI employee based in New York who forwarded the initial report about the overheard conversation to colleagues for vetting.

events.title: Conversation overheard at De Novo Bar
events.description: A retired FBI agent overheard two women discussing the Epstein case at the De Novo Bar in Montclair, NJ. The conversation included claims about money sent to a Swiss bank account after Epstein's death, four BOP employees involved, and alleged failures in jail procedures.

keyFacts: A retired FBI agent reported overhearing a conversation about the Epstein case in a New Jersey bar on August 16, 2019.
The conversation claimed that after Epstein's death, money was sent to a Swiss bank account and that four BOP employees were involved.
The conversation also alleged procedural failures at the jail, including moving a cellmate and correctional officers not performing proper checks.
The agent took photographs of the women involved and their car's license plate.
Subsequent vetting by law enforcement found no connections between the woman discussed and the case, and no evidence she was involved.
